summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, denying Maxwell's motions to suppress evidence and ordering the unsealing of several previously sealed documents, including a 2019 memorandum decision and transcripts of ex parte hearings.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, whose motions to suppress evidence are being denied by the court.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, denying Maxwell's motions and ordering the unsealing of documents.

events.title: Court Denies Maxwell's Suppression Motions
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan denies Ghislaine Maxwell's motions to suppress evidence and orders the unsealing of previously sealed documents.

events.title: Government's Application to Modify Protective Order
events.description: Memorandum decision and order on the Government's application to modify the protective order in the Maxwell case.

events.title: Ex Parte Hearing on Protective Order
events.description: Transcript of ex parte hearing on the Government's application to modify the protective order.

events.title: Second Ex Parte Hearing
events.description: Transcript of second ex parte hearing on the Government's application to modify the protective order.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Judge Alison J. Nathan denied Ghislaine Maxwell's motions to suppress evidence in her criminal case.
The court ordered the unsealing of several documents including a 2019 memorandum decision and transcripts of ex parte hearings from March and April 2019.
The parties were given three days to propose redactions to the court's opinion and one week to propose redactions to the unsealed documents.
The order references the Second Circuit's opinion in Lugosch v. Pyramid Co. of Onondaga as the legal standard for proposed redactions.
The documents to be unsealed were previously filed as Exhibits D, E, F, and G to Maxwell's first motion to suppress.
